definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)

sentences.english: Phelps' eight gold medals and seven world records left you in awe.
sentences.chinese: 菲爾普斯的八塊金牌和七項世界紀錄讓人肅然起敬。

sentences.english: It was great fun, but the outcome was nothing to laugh at.
sentences.chinese: 雖然剛開始很好笑，但結果卻令人起敬。

sentences.english: His courage make me respecting for him.
sentences.chinese: 他的勇氣不禁令人肅然起敬。

sentences.english: He was probably a worthy member of society .
sentences.chinese: 他可能是一個令人起敬的社會成員。

sentences.english: The problem is that most people are awestruck by your fabulousness .
sentences.chinese: 問題是大多數人對你只是肅然起敬。

sentences.english: We were awe-struck by this outpouring of love, inspiration, and energy.
sentences.chinese: 那傾瀉而至的愛心鼓勵和力量令人肅然起敬由衷驚歎。

definition: to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to feel ashamed at being inferior (idiom)
to be completely convinced/to fully accept another person's views
